title: Synthetic Recap
body:
AP SPORTS

DETROIT (AP) – In the crucible of a tight road game, the Miami Heat looked to one man, and he delivered with the force of a hurricane. Alonzo Mourning, a colossus in the paint, authored a performance for the ages, pouring in a career-high 42 points to single-handedly power the Heat past the Detroit Pistons, 108-99.

From the opening tip, it was clear this would be Mourning’s night. He was an unstoppable force, a study in power and precision against a helpless Pistons defense. Each turn-around jumper, each thunderous dunk, and each powerful move through the lane chipped away at Detroit’s resolve. His 42 points weren't just a number; they were a relentless, quarter-by-quarter demolition of the opposition's will.

While Mourning dominated the interior, Tim Hardaway orchestrated the assault, dishing out 13 assists and finding his center with dizzying regularity. The Pistons, led by Grant Hill’s efficient 26 points, fought valiantly, staying within striking distance for much of the contest. But every time Detroit threatened to close the gap, the answer was simple and devastating: get the ball to Zo.

His historic night wasn't just about scoring; he anchored the defense with 3 blocked shots, a complete, two-way masterpiece. This was more than a win; it was a statement. On a night when one man ascended to a career peak, the Miami Heat rode the broad shoulders of Alonzo Mourning to a hard-fought victory, a testament to a singular, unforgettable performance that will be etched in franchise lore.
